Some Things I've Built

Strife

A full-stack SPA clone of discord. Create channels within servers to chat with friends. You can also create DM's and group DM's.

  • Postgres
  • Rails

Some Things I've Built

Strife

A full-stack SPA clone of Discord. Create channels within servers to chat with friends. You can also create DM's and group DM's.

  • ActionCable
  • Redux
  • React
  • Postgres
  • Rails

Smartphone Car

Smartphone Car is a Vanilla JS driving simulator that transforms your phone into a gyroscope-based controller. It creates a unique connection between your phone and the computer using Socket.IO and listens for movement via the DeviceMotion API

  • JavaScript
  • Three.JS
  • Socket.IO
  • Express
  • DeviceMotion API

Reddit Lite

There's a lot more to this app that goes on under the hood. On the frontend is a lie clone of Reddit. Behind the scenes there is caching with URQL, requests made using GraphQL, queries being made with TypeORM and more

  • Redis
  • TypeORM
  • URQL
  • GraphQL
  • TypeScript
  • Chakra-UI
  • Next.JS
  • React

Blockup

This was a group project in which I acted as the Lead Engineer and honestly my team really pulled through. This is a neat communication MERN app that enforces 2FA after sign up and allows users to chat, talk, and video call other users or groups.

  • MongoDB
  • Express
  • React
  • Node
  • Socket.IO
  • WebRTC
  • Web Speech
  • AWS S3

KloudySky V1

What you see now is the first iteration of my portfolio. I am by no means a designer. Much of the design for V1 was inspired by Brittany Chiang's Portfolio. I am currently working on V2.

  • FontAwesome
  • Fullpage.JS
  • Bootstrap
  • Three.JS
  • CSS
  • HTML

PathFindr - In Progress

I'm currently working on a neat React app that creates a visualization of how different algorithms find a path to a taget.

  • JavaScript
  • React

About Me

Hi! My name is Adam and in the last 7 years, I’ve enjoyed the thrill and challenge of bootstrapping my own startup, supporting a promising angel funded startup and running a technical recruiting agency. It’s been fun and I’ve learned more than I ever expected. Although coding has always somehow been part of my journey, I’ve devoted my career to Software Engineering and recently completed App Academy’s full stack development course.

I also love Korean Food and enjoy spending time with family and friends.
